meanings.definition: Worn or eroded by exposure to the weather.
meanings.sent1: The old barn looked weatherworn after years of rain and sun.
meanings.sent2: The statue in the park appeared weatherworn from being outside all year.
meanings.sent3: The weatherworn scarecrow seemed to have a permanent windblown hairstyle.
meanings.sent4: Her face, weatherworn by time, told stories of a life well-lived.
meanings.sent5: The weatherworn signpost pointed the way with a rustic charm.

meanings.definition: Showing the effects of exposure to the weather.
meanings.sent1: The weatherworn fence had a faded paint that hinted at its age.
meanings.sent2: The weatherworn rocks along the shore glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The weatherworn mailbox looked like it had seen too many rainy days.
meanings.sent4: Her weatherworn hands bore the marks of hard work and perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The weatherworn roof creaked in the wind, a testament to its endurance.
